]]> By: Philipp Schmidt http://sharing-nicely.net/2007/08/assessment-and-accreditation-the-missing-pices-in-the-open-education-world/#comment-12 Wed, 08 Oct 2008 07:49:45 +0000 http://bokaap.net/bits-and-pieces/assessment-and-accreditation-the-missing-pices-in-the-open-education-world/#comment-12 Hi Werutz: I am by no means an expert on SQL or database programming, so I wouldn’t be able to point you to the best open educational resources on the topic.

The mysql project has a number of mailing lists (http://lists.mysql.com/) that could probably help with your question. Also, just participating in the mailing list and raising questions, and helping answer other peoples’ questions, is a tremendous learning experience. In a large study conducted by UNU-MERIT (http://www.merit.unu.edu), many developers mentioned that learning and sharing knowledge were key motivating factors for their participation.

Best – P
